result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Leslie Shawn Dashner

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Leslie Shawn Dashner in court.  Attorney Brett Lee Copeland in court for Leslie Shawn Dashner.  Attorney Grace M. Gall in court for State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests a status date.  Court set date as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.
Status conference scheduled for November 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

BRANCH 19 FOR BRANCH 40
Defendant Leslie Shawn Dashner in court with attorney Brett Lee Copeland.  William R. F. Ackell for Grace Gall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a hearing to determined status of counsel. Attorney Brett Copeland has been appointed to represent defendant,
 Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. 
Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. 
Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. 
Case is adjourned to Br 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.

Defendant Leslie Shawn Dashner in court.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for cause to the trial court for a State V. Lee Hearing. Case to be heard in the pair court for Br. 40.  Hearing scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Leslie Shawn Dashner in court, appear by video.  Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. SPD has not appointed counsel. State requests the matter be sent to the trial court for a State V. Lee hearing. Request is denied. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Leslie Shawn Dashner in court by video.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with JMS, JC.
No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Defendant Leslie Shawn Dashner in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Daniel T Flaherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 4/11/22 @ 1:30p
